title: Unspecified error occurred. Check logs. MAC user
body:
So a few days ago I bought a new router (Belkin N300 from a Netgear). Had league do its updated and tried to play a game. Every time I'd get into a game or even the loading screen it would disconnect/crash. It has been like this for a few days. I've changed the DNS, done the port forwarding, even uninstalled and did a fresh install. It continued to pop up with the error. I now went to the actual folder with LoL and went to the deploy folder, etc until i got to the LoLPatcher and right now I have that loading to see if it will do the same thing. I can get as far as 60% before the error pops up. Help please!

This is a Mac Mini (I believe), its just a small motherboard. I'm also up to date with the latest iOS for Mac.

Edit: I was able to complete the download but when I try to get into a game, it just crashes on me. I will try restarting my router and see if that helps.

replies.body:
Since this happened just after replacing your other router, I recommend swapping your old router back in to see if anything changes. If you're able to bypass the issue, then the new router may be faulty. Additionally, you can try a wired connection to your router to see if this is caused by the wireless adapter in your Mac (if you're connected via WiFi).

Let me know if either of those caused a change.
